intro: Adesmia monosperma, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrpea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and yellow flowers. Its fruit is a pod that contains a single seed, hence the species name *monosperma*. Adesmia monosperma is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
